entries.title: Live updates: Beware of the darkest day in the calendar
Kwarteng rebuked for scrapping industrial policy plan
entries.description: Ex-Tory business minister Greg Clark says move by his successor was ‘mystifying’

entries.title: UK to tighten anti-protest measures, despite criticism from rights groups
entries.description: Legal definition of ‘serious disruption’ to be broadened, allowing police to act earlier against demonstrations

entries.title: FirstFT: US companies are turning to convertible bonds
entries.description: Also in today’s newsletter, Israelis protest Netanyahu’s judicial reforms and the BoJ prepares for a big policy decision

entries.title: Sunak to block Scottish transgender bill using constitutional ‘nuclear option’
entries.description: Move likely to anger Holyrood though London set to bring forward long-delayed plans to ban conversion therapy

entries.title: Top global companies write down billions as deals make way for gloom
entries.description: Business leaders prepare to meet in Davos as a third of the world economy is forecast to be in recession this year

entries.title: UK and EU to hold fresh N Ireland protocol talks after progress on data
entries.description: Tory revolt also brewing over MPs claiming a say in proposed bonfire of EU laws

entries.title: Just another blue Monday
entries.description: Mid-January brings supposed depression, but the week ends in celebration

entries.title: Health unions in England warn of more strikes unless pay offer improves
entries.description: Threat comes ahead of another week of industrial action by nurses, ambulance drivers and rail workers

entries.title: Commercial construction groups charge highest rates in two decades
entries.description: Insolvencies soar as fixed-price contracts leave builders unable to pass on cost inflation to customers

entries.title: Peru declares state of emergency in Lima after deadly protests
entries.description: Dozens killed as police clash with demonstrators demanding resignation of Dina Boluarte

entries.title: Will UK inflation data show the BoE’s strategy is paying off?
entries.description: Market Questions is the FT’s guide to the week ahead

entries.title: How to solve the problem of university strikes
entries.description: Students and staff will suffer unless we find a lasting way to fund British undergraduate degrees

entries.title: US companies turn to convertible bonds as equity fundraising stalls
entries.description: Market for assets that mix debt and equity is ‘seeing activity’ as valuations steady and economic data offer hope

entries.title: Geopolitics threatens to destroy the world Davos made
entries.description: World Economic Forum delegates fear that a long period of peace and economic integration could be coming to a close

entries.title: Sweden is navigating an international identity crisis
entries.description: War in Ukraine and economic activism in Europe are causing Stockholm to nuance traditional stances

entries.title: China’s rapid reopening will stir the global economy
entries.description: The end of ‘zero-Covid’ has implications for growth and inflation around the world

entries.title: Bond traders set to test BoJ ahead of key policy decision
entries.description: Expectation grows among investors that Haruhiko Kuroda could scrap yield curve control measures

entries.title: Energy crisis roils Kepco and local debt market
entries.description: South Korean utility resorts to bumper bond issuance as it struggles to cope with rising costs

entries.title: Russian fertiliser export revenue surged 70% in 2022 as prices jumped
entries.description: Volumes only fell by 10 per cent despite analysts’ predictions of a collapse in shipments after start of Ukraine war

entries.title: The lure of Singapore: Chinese flock to ‘Asia’s Switzerland’
entries.description: Geopolitical tension has increased the city-state’s attraction as a financial outpost and safe haven. But can it maintain its neutrality?

entries.title: ‘We are not revolutionaries’: Business warms to Labour-led Westminster council
entries.description: Party seeks to dispel companies’ fears after historic gain of closely watched local authority

entries.title: Colombia’s $20bn takeover battle turns ugly after year-long fight
entries.description: Allegations of media favouritism and poor governance fly as stakes rise for billionaire Jaime Gilinski

entries.title: EU parliament vows more ethics reforms after ‘historic corruption’
entries.description: Bribery scandal has prompted soul-searching at the European parliament

entries.title: US stockpiles natural gas as warm winter temperatures cut demand
entries.description: Futures prices tumble as forecasters say milder temperatures are likely to persist until spring

entries.title: Wanted: older workers for flexible and desirable jobs
entries.description: Growing numbers of companies are changing their attitudes towards age and targeting over-50s for key roles

entries.title: WHO calls on China to release more data on Covid-19 outbreak
entries.description: Beijing reported almost 60,000 deaths in a month since abandoning pandemic restrictions

entries.title: The Xi nobody saw coming
entries.description: China’s hardline leader has reversed his decisions on a wide range of policies, wrongfooting the rest of the world
